Show HN: Path MTU Discovery Test
text:
While there are plenty of ways to test if your MTU is set correctly and that Path MTU Discovery works, I haven't seen a browser based test that works in both directions.

Hope this is useful for someone. Source code on github https://github.com/russor/pmtud_test (Server is Yaws on FreeBSD)

Show HN: Do you need a Tourist Visa to travel to Europe?
text:
Hi HN! This is a simple app I built to see whether you need a tourist visa (=Schengen Visa) when traveling to Europe.

Problem:

1) It isn't clear whether your passport allows you to enter Europe (here, only Schengen states for now)

2) Finding out requires a bit of Googling (though nothing too crazy) and reading through documentation online.

Solution: Simply select your country to figure out if you need a Schengen Visa.

Obviously, this isn't a revolutionary app, but I can add more here if there's demand ie find the nearest embassies based on your location, waiting times based on port of entry/major time spent etc.

I am an absolute newbie at frontend programming, so feedback is more than welcome.

Tell HN: Sites like Kiwifarms are destroying free speech
text:
Over the last few days, there's been a lot of discussion about kiwifarms being taken offline by Cloudflare. As is expected from HN, the average response was one appalled by the apparent free speech violation, and a general concern for the precedent being set.

While I understand the sentiment, and have thought the same in the past ( with Aaron Swartz or Chelsea Manning); I want to pose an alternative question: What's the precedence set by continuing to do business with kiwifarms?

Over the last few days there's been a lot I've wanted to say, but I felt like I couldn't speak. I've been on HN for the better part of a decade, but I can't say anything as myself. Instead I need to use a throwaway account and only connect over a VPN, because I'm a trans woman talking about kiwifarms.

I've seen how dangerous it can be for a trans woman to stick her head up. I've watched friends and strangers alike be harassed, attacked, SWAT'd, and doxxed. Not public figures (though they don't deserve death threats either), just regular trans people trying to live their lives and speak their experiences.

I no longer feel like I can speak up, for fear of illegal reprisals. Why should they be allowed to infringe on my rights? Why should I have to hide?

Cloudflair's decision to stop doing business with kiwifarms is a step towards free speech, not away.

Ask HN: Can easy remote training and evaluation make difference for your compny?
text:
Dear bosses,

I have developed an experimental application for easy remote employees training and evaluation:

https://Background.webcam

It provides a mutual video connection with privacy, so you can keep the video on and get to know your new hires faster.

Can it make a difference for your business? Widen your hiring geography, increase remote work productivity, something else?
